reviewText: DVD series advertised as "All NEW" season 4. However, all episodes were previously already shown on T.V in March / April 2016 . I should have realized something was wrong when Acorn (Company that has first release rights for British programs) had no postings for new release of DCI Banks. Amazon should have posted these episodes were previously already shown from previous season. I previously purchased Season 4 DCI Banks (region 2-Europe, I own DVD player needed) that was also erroneous presented, contained episodes from earlier seasons. I'm returning this DVD set, and will purchase this series from Acorn, in the future.
not as good as previous series

Actually, four and a half stars.  Three more solid outings for DCI Banks and his female partners, each of whom is still conflicted in her personal life.  Each episode is approximately 1 1/2 hours in length, divided into separate 45 minute segments.  The atmospherics are strong.  Leeds remains gritty; the skies remain gray; the blood continues to flow.  Stephen Tompkinson continues to be able to express a wide range of emotions through the movements of his eyebrows and laugh lines.  No episode stands out as particularly strong but all measure up to a common level of high quality.

Now, the consumer issue: a Dutch version is available from Amazon.co.uk (which I purchased).  It is far less expensive than this version.  It is in English, but the subtitles are in Dutch and the discs cannot be played on standard American dvd players.  In a number of scenes the subtitles would have been helpful, since a number of the characters speak quickly and use a lot of English idiom.  The price difference, however, was compelling for us.  My recommendation: if you don't have an all-regions dvd player (and you watch a lot of English television), consider buying one.  With the price differentials they pay for themselves very quickly.  I recommend players made by Pioneer.  We have had two of them and have been pleased in each case.  They are simple to set up and the modern all-regions players read the discs when they are inserted and play whatever you have fed them.  You no longer have to code each disc or go through any intermediate steps.  Some of the best British series (Dalziel and Pascoe, e.g.) have only been available via the Dutch and the regular English/American versions often differ significantly in price.  With an all-regions player, no problem.  Amazon.com sells them; check them out.
Can't get enough of DCI Banks!

WARNING: Because of the one year delay in releasing Season Four, several dealers have imported it from the Netherlands. But the Dutch DVDs won't play on most U.S. DVD players. Hint - If the cover reads: "Gebaseerd op de Boeken von Peter Robinson - De Complete Vierde Serie", you have the Dutch version. Don't order this unless you need you need Dutch subtitles - and own a region-free DVD player.* Season Four was finally released in North America on June 28, 2016. Amazon's search engine is now giving priority to the North American version. Photo 1 = North American version Photo 2 = Dutch version ---------------- This excellent and gritty British police series debuted in 2010. Filmed in Yorkshire, primarily in the city of Leeds (population 750,000) Since the series began, Stephen Tompkinson has played Detective Chief Inspector Alan Banks, and Andrea Lowe has played Detective Sergeant Annie Cabbot. There is a surprising amount of sexual tension on this show. D.S. Cabbot took maternity leave at the start of Season Two. Nobody knows who the father is, and there is a great deal of speculation among her fellow officers. [No, DCI Banks is not the father.] In Season Two, Caroline Catz, as Detective Inspector Helen Morton, was brought in as a temporary replacement, but has caught on and is now part of the team. (I have a major crush on this woman. This was her first series after "Doc Martin"). D.S. Cabbot came back as a single mother in Season Three. All three are back for Season Four. My only concern is that there was entirely too much fraternization between the ranks in Season Three. Too much "Boinking" Too much "Rogering" Too much "Shagging" Too much "Hiding the Sausage" Too much "Taking Old One-Eye to the Optometrist" --- British euphemisms for sexual intercourse (from the Online Slang Dictionary) The implied sexual tension of Seasons One and Two is out in the open. I would have thought the lower ranks were off-limits to Detective Chief Inspectors. In my thirty years of experience with the British Police, this sort of thing never turns out well. Surprise: When Season Four opens, the romance between DCI Banks and DS Annie Cabbot has fizzled. Sergeant Cabbot has gone back to her old boyfriend. Most of the first episode is spent with DCI Banks mooning around for his lost love. It doesn't help when Banks discovers that his romantic rival is training for the Ironman Triathlon. English SDH subtitles. My only real complaint is the lack of a Blu-Ray version. Still five stars. GOOD NEWS: Season Five has been announced for pre-order on Amazon. BAD NEWS: The release date is March 7, 2017. No dealers have imported the Dutch version of Season Five (yet) ---------- LINKS ON AMAZON ----------- [hint: for ease of navigation, read through to the end, then come back and click on the links.] ___ Pilot (2010) = DCI Banks: Aftermath Season 1 (2011) = DCI Banks: Season 1 Season 2 (2012) = DCI Banks: Season 2 Season 3 (2014) = DCI Banks: Season Three Season 4 (2015) = DCI Banks: Season Four - REVIEWED ON THIS PAGE Season 5 (2016) = DCI Banks: Season 5 All have English SDH subtitles Watch the Pilot before watching Season 1, Episode 2 ("Friend of the Devil") - a continuing story. --------------- * Region-free DVD players are actually a good idea. Unfortunately you won't find them at Best Buy, Target or Walmart. They are not illegal, but the big retailers are under a lot of pressure not to sell them. On the Amazon search bar, under "Electronics" enter "region free dvd player" Several models under $50. All DVD players are region-free when they come from the factory. The regional encoding software is programmed in later. It can be deprogrammed by someone who knows what they are doing (there is a computer port on the back of your DVD player - along with a warning label that it is for authorized technicians only). I have owned a Toshiba region-free player for two years, and it plays flawlessly. In addition to playing every DVD in the world (PAL or NTSC), it will also play region A and region-free blu-rays, but not European region B blu-rays. Region-free blu-ray players are available, but more pricey - in the $200 range (but the price will almost certainly come down if you are patient). - but read the description carefully: "region-free DVD / Blu-Ray player" is not the same as "region-free DVD / region-free Blu-Ray player".
Great series..

I'm a fan of DCI Banks. The characters are well written and the stories are filled with morally challenged characters. The latter 2 episodes of this season annoyed me a little because Annie did bad police work. In one instance in each episode she clearly violated illegal searches (by US Law). I'm not sure if the books are written like this.
 Unlike the multitude of US Crime Dramas, I'm a fan of the British series because they are mysteries. They are not action dramas with car chases, gunfights, and machismo. I'm curious to start Season 5 soon.
enjoyable
great as usual
Can't go wrong ordering a BBC Production.

I bought the second season at Barnes & noble on a whim and fell in love with show, so that is how I wound up purchasing this one from you.  The actors are great and they make a detective show worth watching.
Enjoyed it as much as the other 3.  Great writing and acting.

We have thoroughly enjoyed this series which gives a deeper look into the actions and reactions of the DCIs.  Have found British movies to be of better structure than American and the characters more interesting.
Great series and glad to get the next instalment
Well written, good acting.

For ,those of us who are Peter Robinson fans of his books festuring DCI Alan Banks, we were overjoyed to see him come to life in the ITV series. DCI Banks is the head of detectives in the Yorkshire area, and all if the cases take place in these surroundings. We see the city, the country and everything in between.

Alan Banks look like a morose character with not much personality. Stephen Tompkinsin plays Banks. Ah, no, not true., he gas a rich life sometimes. Once married, he has a grown daughter, and in some episodes she is very much present. He lives in a lovely house, and his lives arecwine and music. You may find him at night in his study with wine listening to his favorite music. His other life is his job, and he is good at it. You may be surprise to hear he with his team solves every case.

Andrea Lowe, the beautiful blonde, impetuous at times, plays DS Annie Cabot. She flits in and out if Banks life as his sometime lover. An excellent detective, but makes hasty decisions. DI Morton, played by Carolyn Catz, a lovely brunette, wears a severe haircut. Does not allow emotion into much of her life. She is often brusque with people, needs to learn social skills, and I wonder if she In on the Autism spectrum. She is brilliant and most often correct. I like her best. The Team investigates their crimes, digs up all of the facts and solves every crime. A lot of murder and mayhem, abound.

Recommended. prisrob 03-21-17
great
Loved the stories and the characters. It was just was what I'd hoped for with this series.
Love this series and well worth buying.

I love mysteries and DCI Banks has become one of my favorites.  Working with two beautiful women cannot be easy since he is a bachelor.  This program has become one of my favorites.  This edition was a disappointment because  I was hoping that it would end differently.
another great English drama/action series. its best to start with the first season and follow the characters and their development. very well made. also this was a used DVD in very good condition.
A great British Detective Mystery series!
I enjoyed all four seasons.  I would recommend this to a friend.  Some plots were a bit predicable, but there are enough twists to keep it interesting.
this is a typical police procedure genre. Good evening entertainment.
DVDs were region 1 NTSC and played perfectly. Disappointed there were no extras, just a boring commentary track.
Excellent series!

One of my favorite British detective shows. the actors have great chemistry and the writing is wonderful and tells a great story each time. The stories are enthusiastic while you have a chance to get into the interpersonal goings-on of the characters without being sappy..

My hubby and I both love DCI Banks and the season four is great.  We particularly like Stephen Tompkinson (we first met him in Ballykissangel) and love Carolin Katz (first met her in Doc Martin)  so we knew this series would be good.  Turned out to better than good - its great!
Great value.
Great series!
Excellent series!
Fantastic series.  It's a shame that it has ended.

I like this although it is the typically grim, miserable BBC detective fare.  Man, nobody's happy in these things.  Their personal lives are crap and they carry the weight of the world.  The other thing that jumps out at me this season, the females almost never stop snapping.  This is realistic, as it is what stressed females do, but it wears on the soul.
enjoyed it
Great, as expected. I now have all four seasons including the pilot, 'Aftermath'.
A+ series
Personal issues of the cast reach a new level with this series which take away from the story.
I love this series.  Wish season 5 would be released sooner than expected date.  I believe it is in 2017 . . . . hate waiting for next dvd.
Satisfactory.
I love the DCI Banks series. I've bought them all and not one of them was a disappointment.  I love all the characters and the story lines are great. The British know how to make a mystery.
very pleased
Big fan of this series, and season 4 did not disappoint. Can hardly wait for season 5. Just wish there were more episodes.
Like the series but personal relationships were not really explained.  In one season they're a couple, next not....no explanation.
From "Aftermath" throughout the entire series, this is an excellent series.

I liked it.  The shows are intense & interesting to watch.  I like to keep up with their individual lives, too, because it adds to the show's sense of reality as portrayed out by the actors.  I can't wait to see in Season 5 if DS Cabot goes through with  her marriage to her daughter, Isla;s dad, the lawyer who was portrayed in earlier episodes not to be as ethical nor to have the same values & beliefs as Annie.  She & DCI Banks have more in common together, but, maybe she can help change the lawyer over to more of her values & beliefs.  I can't wait to buy Season 5 when available.
This is a great series.  Always a winner.

Take the moroseness of Wallander, the social skills of Doc Martin and the love life of Inspector Morse and you get DCI Banks.  I love all the British detective shows - Vera, Shetland, Midsomer, Lewis, Marple, Poirot, etc - but DCI Banks is torture to watch.  At the end of a 45 minute episode you will feel like you watched an hour and a half of bad TV.  Its a cop show so there should be some excitement, shouldn't there?  British TV production values are as good as ever in regards to the sets and videography.  It's just that the scripts seem so bad but it could be the acting of Stephen Tompkinson who's face looks like a pig's ass.
Good show this.
great acting and exceptional script!!!!!!!
This season is the weakest of the four I have. Like many of the British series, a season is but a few episodes so in terms of value...not good
I really enjoyed the entire four seasons.  I had marathon viewing seasons.
Only negative comment is that it only comes out once a year!
One of my favorite programs

Love Caroline Catz in everything I've seen her in, especially Doc Martin.  I couldn't wait to see season 4 of DCI Banks, which is why I bought the UK version of the DVD.  Anticipate watching it again in  six months or so.

have all the other Banks dvds.  Don't know if they've changed writers or something, but these were really boring.  Seems they want to go the political correctness route all of a sudden.  One's about eastern European slaves, another's about Muslims.  Was falling asleep in the second episode.
Really good.

Great movie

Before buying the "DCI Banks" TV series, we read all of the books by Peter Robinson. We loved the books! (doesn't bode well for a TV series based on them).  So far, we have watched the pre-series movie and one season. While we are not as enamored with the series as we have been with other British crime shows, we will watch them all.  Because the stories from the books require more time than a one-hour TV show, most are split between two episodes, at a minimum. This is fine, especially when you have the entire series on disc.  Like more British shows, it is worth a watch, but so far it is not our favorite The shows would probably be better if we had not read the books first.
Good dective stories
We finally can see the end of a program that was interupted!

Pretty good British Murder/police series. I could do without the romantic relationship between the DCI and DS, but that seems to have resolved itself in a future season. They should stuck to the crime story plots which are written really well.
Best series ever! Superb acting and stories! Recommend.
